rename.from: Place holder issue for security issue

issue.title: Information regarding CVE-2020-28924

labels.name: Priority: P1
labels.description: The most important issues like security issues and major crash bugs

issue.body:
On  2020-11-19 17:00 UTC, a newly discovered security vulnerability in rclone was published. As described in [this post by **ncw**](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4783), the vulnerability affects some randomly generated passwords and tokens. If you are running rclone on your PC, Mac or server,...
* Update rclone to the latestes version (`1.53.3` as of writing this notice).
* Review the linked security information for further information.  **You may have to change your crypt passwords.**

### Security of RCX
We have analysed the sitation and have so far determined that RCX is **not affected**.  

RCX uses its own password generation mechanism with a secure source of randomness. However, our analysis has shown that we don't yet completely use the provided keyspace for maximum entropy, and will further increase this in a future update.

#### Details
As described in the linked issue, the following functionalities were affected by this issue:

*    `fs/config/config.go: Password = random.Password`
      * RCX does not use this function
*    `fs/rc/rcserver/rcserver.go: randomPass, err := random.Password(128)`
      * RCX does not use this function
 *  `lib/oauthutil/oauthutil.go: state, err := random.Password(128)`
      * This is not a security vulnerability in RCX

### Security of rclone on Termux
**If you are using rclone on Termux, the security information as referenced below also applies**. The update PR [has already been merged](https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/pull/6049) and is available via `pkg upgrade`.

### Links
[https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4783](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4783)


### Edits
_EDIT 2020-11-19-19:30: Added details about RCX password generation_
_EDIT 2020-11-19-21:05: Termux update_

issue.title: üÜï Software Suggestion | Rclone

repository.name: privacytools.io
repository.description: üõ°üõ† You are being watched. Protect your privacy against global mass surveillance.

issue.body:
## Basic Information

**Name: Rclone**
**Category: File Sync**
**URL: https://rclone.org**

## Description

*Rclone* is a command line program to manage files on cloud storage. It is a feature rich alternative to cloud vendors' web storage interfaces. Over 40 cloud storage products support rclone including S3 object stores, business & consumer file storage services, as well as standard transfer protocols.

*Rclone* has powerful cloud equivalents to the unix commands rsync, cp, mv, mount, ls, ncdu, tree, rm, and cat. Rclone's familiar syntax includes shell pipeline support, and --dry-run protection. It is used at the command line, in scripts or via its API.


## Why I am making the suggestion

<!-- Anything you would like to tell us about the software? -->

*Rclone* is basically *rsync* on steroids. and their (experimental) web GUI is a game changer.


## My connection with the software

<!-- Are you the author? Enthustiastic or early adopter? Friends with the author or requested by them to open the isue? An employee of the software maker? -->

No affiliation.

- [X] I will keep the issue up-to-date if something I have said changes or I remember a connection with the software.

issue.title: RClone at v.1.53.0 - Update always to latest version

repository.name: rclonebrowser-docker
repository.description: A repository for creating a docker container including RClone Browser with GUI interface.

issue.body:
Hi,

I'm not really sure why because as far as I can see it the link in the Dockerfile `http://downloads.rclone.org/rclone-${RCLONE_VERSION}-linux-${ARCH}.zip` should always point to the current version of rclone as tested via Browser. Still however RcloneBrowser seems to run with 1.53.0 currently. Is there any way to update always to the latest version?
1.53.0 seems pretty old and a lot if things have changed and serious issues have been fixed, e.g. generating weak passwords https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4783.

![Unbenannt](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17931739/151134023-a1b3c6b0-af8d-43a4-af9f-f263a9249df2.JPG)

Thanks for any input!
